intro: Achaetogeron galeottii, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun conditions. Its flowers are borne on short pedicels and are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Achaetogeron galeottii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
